summary: This document is a daily lieutenant's log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, NY, covering three shifts on July 27, 2019. It details routine operations, counts, and security checks, with specific notes that inmate Jeffrey Epstein was on psychological observation/suicide watch with an inmate companion and was at a local hospital/nursing facility under USMS guard. The log also notes another inmate, Lopez, was placed on psychological observation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76315-054 (also listed as #76318-054) on psychological observation/suicide watch with an inmate companion. Document notes he was at a local hospital/nursing facility under guard by USMS.

persons.name: Lopez
persons.context: Inmate #20472-038 placed on psychological observation in the Special Housing Unit after being found incoherent and admitting to smoking K-2.

connections.description: Both were inmates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on the same date, as recorded in the facility log.

events.title: Epstein on Psychological Observation/Suicide Watch
events.description: The daily log records inmate Jeffrey Epstein as being on psychological observation (later updated to suicide watch during the evening shift) with an inmate companion. He was noted as being at a local hospital/Goldcrest nursing facility under guard by US Marshals.

events.title: Inmate Lopez Placed on Psych Observation
events.description: Inmate Lopez (#20472-038) was placed on psychological observation in the Special Housing Unit after being found incoherent and admitting to smoking K-2.

events.title: Routine Facility Operations and Counts
events.description: Standard correctional facility operations including multiple institutional counts, body alarm tests, metal detector checks, and fire watch due to inoperable fire systems.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: On July 27, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was recorded as being on psychological observation/suicide watch at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
Epstein was noted to be at a local hospital or Goldcrest nursing facility under guard by US Marshals Service personnel during this time.
The facility's fire alarm and sprinkler systems were non-operational, requiring a fire watch to be in progress.
Another inmate, Lopez, was placed on psychological observation after admitting to smoking synthetic cannabinoids (K-2).
The document is a routine administrative log, showing standard prison operations and counts on the date in question.
